article_title: U.S. Workers' Health Costs Up 134% In Last Decade, Hit $5,000

article_metadata.description: As employers continue to shift a larger share of health costs onto their employees, the combined premium and out-of-pocket costs will surpass $5,000 for the first time next year, according to a new analysis from Aon Hewitt. Employees are just now getting a glimpse of these costs as they select health benefits [...]
article_metadata.author: Bruce Japsen
